project.name: |-- 001-basic-io
project.description:
Keywords: + FileSystem, FileSystems + Path, Paths + Files + DirectoryStream + walkFileTree + File copy, move + Input streams, output streams + ByteBuffer + SeekableByteChannel
This project includes very simple examples involving the new IO API.
FileSystemAndPathsRunner: Demonstrates how to use some FileSystem and Path methods without creating files or directories.
CreateFilesAndDirsRunner: Demonstrates how to create and delete files and directories.
ListDirContentsRunner: Demonstrates how to list the immediate contents of file, how to manually list recursively a directory, and how to do it with the new JDK7 API.
CopyAndMoveFilesRunner: Demonstrates how to copy and move files.
ReadAndWriteSmallFilesRunner: Demonstrates how to read and write small text files using Files.read() and Files.write().
FileCompareRunner: Very simplistic file comparison tool that demonstrates how to read binary files.
BinaryStreamCopyRunner: Very simplistic file copy program that demonstrate how to read binary files and how to write them.
OutputStreamWriterTestRunner: Demonstrates how you can write unicode characters as Chinese Simplified GB2312 file. If you open the resulting file with an application capable of displaying Chinese GB2312 characters you will see the correct result. Note, how as the file is not written in UTF-8 the bytes written on the output file will be different from the ones you specified. However, in the utf-16 file you would get FE FE followed by the chars you wrote.
PrintWriterTestRunner: Demonstrates how to use the PrintWriter wrapped in a BufferedWriter that even specifies the charset.
InputStreamReaderTestRunner: Demonstrates how to read a text file with chinese characters using an InputStreamReader.
BufferedReaderTestRunner: Demonstrates how to use a buffered reader to read text files, one line at a time.
PrintStreamTestRunner: Demonstrates how to redirect System.out to file by creating a PrintStream object.
SeekableByteChannelTestRunner: Demonstrates how to use a ByteBuffer and a SeekableByteChannel to perform random file access operations.
ObjectSerializationTestRunner: Demonstrates how to serialize a simple domain object and a string using an ObjectOutputStream and how to deserialize it using an ObjectInputStream.
